steps: [1] If an inbound connection originates from a blacklisted IP, the IDS flags the connection.
[2] If the IDS flags the connection, the SIEM opens an incident.
[3] If the SIEM opens an incident and auto-blocking is enabled, the firewall auto-blocks the source IP.
[5] An inbound connection originates from a blacklisted IP.
[6] For all hosts x, if host x lacks critical security patches, host x is marked noncompliant.
[7] Host a lacks critical security patches.
[8] For all hosts x, if host x is marked noncompliant, then host x is either quarantined to a remediation network or denied access to sensitive subnets.
[11] The firewall auto-blocks the source IP.
[12] Host a is marked noncompliant and is either quarantined to a remediation network or denied access to sensitive subnets.
